Max actual width (without counting line trailing spaces)
Actual height (only lines with words on it)
Ration between number of chars in the supersequence (including non trailing spaces) and the actual area of the clockface.
Max number of chars per line, without counting traling spaces.
Number of char slots that will be filled with junk characters. Trailing spaces at the end of the line counts as -1 (one char recovered) if they are outside the right margin.
Number of words in the sequence forming the clockface.
Try sequence optimisation by substring inclusion
Try to use longer words that include shorter words as substrings for displaying both (example: 'fourteen' and 'four')
Try filling the clockface by bin packing heuristics
Try to optimise the use of clockface surface by packing words in a compact way (heuristics).
Generate and display the virtual wordclock resulting from this design

Use arrows to move cursor. A - Shift word to the left D - Shift word to the right W - Prepend a space S - Remove prepended space Word movements are allowed only if the resulting sequence will still be able to generate all the time sentences of the clock. All prepended spaces of a word are removed if the word is shifted.

Chasy is using heuristic to find a sequence of words from which it will be possible to compose all the sentences of the clock. It will take about a minute. Be advised that although the sequence will work, there is no guarantee it is the shortest possible one. Knowing the grammar of the language in use, is sometimes possbile to manually improve the automatic solution.
Open a previously saved clockface project.
Save a copy of the current project.
Organise the letters on the clockface.

Generates the time phrases for each of the 1440 minutes in a day.
Includes numeric values in the form "HH:MM".

Generates the time phrases for each of the 1440 minutes in a day.
Phrases are NOT preceded by the HH:MM string.
Provide statistics on the phrases used to output the time.
Provide statistics on the actual text being represented on the clockface.
Generate the collection of files needed to build the actual wordclock.
Module to use for the clock project.
Amount of minutes between two successive steps of the clock.
If the resolution is more than 1 minute, choose the method to approximate the real time.

Minimise the difference between the displayed time and the real one.
Example: with a resolution of 5 minutes, 10:47 is displayed as 10:45, but 10:48 is displayed as 10:50.

Display the last completed "step".
Example: with a resolution of 5 minutes, both 10:47 and 10:48 will be displayed as 10:45.
